text: Katherine Laverne Starks (July 21, 1922 - November 3, 2016), known as Kay Starr, was an American singer. She was popular in the 1940s and 1950s. She is best remembered for introducing two songs that became #1 hits in the 1950s, "Wheel of Fortune" and "The Rock And Roll Waltz". Starr died on November 3, 2016 at her home in Beverly Hills, California from complications of Alzheimer's disease at the age of 94. ==References== ==Other websites== *The Kay Starr homepage *Biography of Kay Starr (in Spanish) *The Iceberg site *Kay Starr discography *Kay Starr interview on KUOW 94.9 (NPR) Seattle, 2006 * Category:1922 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:Disease-related deaths in California Category:American pop singers Category:Singers from Oklahoma Category:Native American singers
title: Kay Starr
